Class BlackjackGameSimulator

java.lang.Object
BlackjackGameSimulator
public class BlackjackGameSimulator extends Object
A simple Blackjack game simulator. This class contains the main method to run a Blackjack game. The user can choose to play the game and place bets. The game continues until the user decides to stop or runs out of money.
Version:
1.0 References used for this assignment: Module 7 Office Hours Presentation (slides talk about ArrayList and Collections) JavadocDemo.pdf
Author:
Katherine (Katie) Barrett

  • Constructor Details

    • BlackjackGameSimulator

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(String[] args)
      The entry point of the Blackjack game simulator. Prompts the user to play the game, handles betting, and updates the total amount of money based on the outcome of the game. The game continues in a loop until the user chooses to stop or runs out of money.
      Parameters:
      args - command line arguments (not used)

    • playGame

      private static String playGame()
      This method contains the logic for playing the game, including dealing cards, managing the player's and dealer's hands, and determining the winner.
      Returns:
      a String indicating the outcome of the game: "Win", "Lose", or "Draw".

    • playerTurn

      private static String playerTurn​(Deck deck, PlayerHand playerHand)
      This method allows the player to choose whether to hit (draw a card) or hold (stop drawing cards). The player's hand is updated based on their choice, and the game outcome is determined if the player reaches 21 or exceeds it. If the player chooses to hold, the method exits the loop and returns null.
      Parameters:
      deck - the Deck object used to deal cards to the player
      playerHand - the PlayerHand object representing the player's hand
      Returns:
      a String indicating the outcome of the player's turn: "Win" if the player draws 21, "Lose" if the player overdrew, or null if the player holds

    • dealerTurn

      private static String dealerTurn​(Deck deck, DealerHand dealerHand, PlayerHand playerHand)
      This method manages the dealer's actions based on the dealer's current hand and the player's hand. If the dealer has 21 at the start, the dealer wins immediately. Otherwise, the dealer continues to draw cards until the dealer's hand reaches at least 17.
      Parameters:
      deck - the Deck object used to deal cards to the dealer
      dealerHand - the DealerHand object representing the dealer's hand
      playerHand - the PlayerHand object representing the player's hand (used to check if player already hit 21 cards or more)
      Returns:
      a String indicating the outcome of the dealer's turn: "Lose" if the dealer wins, "Win" if the player wins, or null otherwise

    • findWinner

      private static String findWinner​(int dealerTotal, int playerTotal)
      This method determines the winner of the Blackjack game based on the final totals of the dealer and the player. It considers only the cases where neither the dealer nor the player has exceeded 21. If both have the same total, the game is a tie.
      Parameters:
      dealerTotal - the final total of the dealer's hand
      playerTotal - the final total of the player's hand
      Returns:
      a String indicating the outcome of the game: "Lose" if the dealer wins, "Win" if the player wins, or "Draw" if the totals are equal. Otherwise, it returns null.
